Hi Adrian,

sorry for the delay.
I attached an image that shows the way our clients communicate with servers.
Whether a client is on site or remote it connects via the onpremise zscaler servers, so their source IP for the recipient server will show up as the LAN address of the zscaler servers.  Only servers can do a connection between other servers using their own IP locally.
The green lines are showing working connections: clients via zscaler could access any server resources (except EPP) , servers could also access EPP at the same time.
The red lines are showing where we had a lot of dropped connections: a lot of clients via zscaler neither on-premise nor remote couldn't connect and the logs on the zscaler server show a lot of timeout. Obesrving the EPP server while connected from an other server (not via zscaler) the connection was instantaneous and no lost packet was observed at the same time.
